page.title: 04SCAMPTON C.E. CHURCH
page.content: The church in Scampton, Lincolnshire is dedicated to St.John the Baptist. It is made of lime stone and has a tower. One of the three{bells}was cast in 1582. The window in the South Chancel is 14th century and shows St. John about to be beheaded. There is a plaque and a banner on the South wall dedicated to the association between the R.A.F. and the village, also the remains of a leper window. The first incumbent was Richard Blunt in 1238. The present incumbent is Rev.C.M.H. Frere. There is the possibility of a {ghost}believed to be the Rev.John Haggard, priest here for 58 years; who died in 1782. The graveyard contains {Royal Airforce}graves of which 72 are British, 12 Canadian, 9 Australian, 3 New Zealand and also the graves of 8 German aircrew.
